oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Ronnie Milsap Parts 4 and 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Ronnie Milsap (performer) for Nashville's WSM. Tape labeled parts 4 and 5. Recording is from an unknown date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Ronnie Milsap
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ronnie Milsap and Ralph Emery clear their throats before addressing the audience -- (00:40) Emery inquires about Milsap's opinion on Merle Haggard -- (01:30) Emery compliments Milsap's "Smokey Mountain Rain" and Milsap reflects on his recordings for RCA -- (03:30) Emery inquires about the last time Milsap did not have a hit song -- (04:22) Milsap reflects on the success of "In No Time at All" and Emery and Milsap reflect on the success of Milsap's tracks -- (06:16) The controversy behind "I Wouldn't Have Missed it For the World" is discussed by Milsap -- (08:07) Emery addresses the crowd and praises Kathy Mattea -- (08:29) Emery questions Milsap about the song that Milsap associates to Joyce Milsap, and Milsap tells the story of how he married Joyce -- (14:01) Terry Gibbs' rendition of "Rocky Top" is discussed -- (14:46) John Anderson and Milsap's enjoyment of fishing is talked about -- (16:04) "Me Heart" is reflected on by Milsap -- (16:49) Emery and Milsap say their goodbyes -- (17:29) Milsap and Emery clear their throats before addressing the audience -- (18:11) Emery and Milsap discuss the time Emery visited Milsap in the studio and Milsap's 'shadow vision' -- (20:07) Emery and Milsap discuss Milsap's extensive gadget collection -- (22:42) Emery and Milsap discuss the early stages of the Computer Age and the adaptation of hardware for the blind -- (27:09) Joe Stample is discussed -- (27:30) Emery and Milsap joke about singing "To Me" -- (28:08) Emery praises Milsap's achievements and both discuss the scale of Milsap's road show -- (30:11) Emery and Milsap discuss the mask Milsap would wear and the success of Milsap's album -- (32:58) Emery and Milsap discuss the time Milsap spent recording for Scepter -- (34:44) Milsap praises Jerry Lee Lewis and Emery introduces "Lonely Weekend" -- (35:27) Emery and Milsap joke about Milsap's weight -- (37:00) Emery and Milsap perform their sign-offs -- (37:35) Emery perform his commercial breaks and both say goodbye -- (37:57) Emery and Milsap discuss the last show Emery did with Tex Ritter away from the mic [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Milsap, Ronnie; Milsap, Ronnie, 1943-;
